job.title: Software/Machine Learning Engineer
job.description: ltstronggtltugtAbout UsltbrgtltbrgtltugtltstronggtTulas core philosophy is built on the idea that every engine or motor whether gas diesel or electric has a socalled sweet spot of efficient operation Tulas DSF and DMD control strategies are designed to have engines both gasoline and diesel and motors operate a greater percentage of time at or near their natural sweet spots and in the process fuelenergy is saved and emissions are reduced Tulas DSF technology has been recognized by the International Council of Clean Transportation ICCT as being one of the technologies that are essential for helping global automakers meet fuel efficiency mandates With more than 340 patents issued and pending were focused on developing applications for passenger automobiles commercial vehicles  both on and off road  and electric vehicles of any sizeltbrgtltbrgtBased in our San Jose CA headquarters the ltstronggtSoftwareMachine Learning Engineerltstronggt will work on the endtoend architecture design and development of machine learning projects for Tulas advanced engine control products You will join an enthusiastic team of developers to innovative ML algorithms for Tulas nextgeneration engine efficiency technologyltbrgtltulgt ltligtDevelop Neural Nets or other ML solutions like Gradient Boosted Models to implement Tula engine fault detection algorithms and autocalibration methodologyltligt ltligtCollaborate with other engineers on data collection coding and prototypingtestingltligt ltligtDevelop code in a structured manner with topdown architectural specification with testing requirement consideredltligt ltligtOversee data collection including requirement processing and validating of dataltligt ltligtUse best practices for software development including functional specs code reviews revision control and unit testingltligt ltbrgtltbrgtltulgtltstronggtltugtRequirementsltbrgtltugtltstronggtltulgt ltligtMS in CS or EE preferred with 35 years of
